comments:
I experienced this issue using Birt 2.0M3 under Eclipse 3.2M4.

To reproduce you will need access to a cvs repository containing an rptdesign file. The following steps should demonstrate the issue:

1. Open the CVS Repositories view
2. Navigate to an rtpdesign file in the tree view.
3. Double-click the file to open it.
4. The report design editor will attempt to open the file.  Instead of the report being opened, an error is displayed in the editor window "Unable to create this part due to an internal error. Reason for the failure: An exception was thrown during initialization".

The exception is:

java.lang.ClassCastException: org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.RemoteFileEditorInput

Ideally I would expect the file could be opened read-only in the designer.  However, at a minimum I would expect better error handling in this case.  I looked at the code briefly and the point where the ClassCastException occurs there appears to be an unnecessary (and in this case erroneous) cast to IReportEditorInput.
reschedule to 2.1 final to allow more time to find a solution that works in both Eclipse IDE and RCP platform.

Currently BIRT report editor (IDE) can open report files that are  managed by the Eclipse workspace only.  We need to investigate the solution to support the following two scenarios:

1. open files in file system,
2. open files in a remote respository,

We should give priority to scenario 1 if we can't have both in BIRT 2.1.

We can open a report design, but the reference elements in the report design may display incorrect. Because BIRT model use URL to find reference elements, open cvs files use cvs connection type may cause model error. We have commit the code to open file system files and cvs remove files, you can check it out, but to fully support cvs files we need a further discuss.

The issue is the library reference. For now, model don't support a remote reference library file for CVS case.
A file withou library reference can open all right now.

BIRT now can open design files in CVS. However, all resources (jar files for scripting, external images, report libraries, translation files, etc..)  that the design file uses needs to be accessible via URL or local file system.  Please an enhancement for BIRT model component if those resources are also in CVS.
